name: 2,2'-Thiene-2,5-diylbis(5-tert-butyl-1,3-benzoxazole)
Reason: 2,2'-Thiene-2,5-diylbis(5-tert-butyl-1,3-benzoxazole) has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. The basic unit for comparison can be 1,3-benzoxazole, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 2,2'-thiene-2,5-diylbis(5-tert-butyl-1,3-benzoxazole) will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which could each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The tert-butyl group (C(C)C) is a bulky group which could add about +10 due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume; (3) The benzoxazole ring (N1CCCC1) and 1-ethyl-4-methylenepiperidine moiety may both add roughly +20 each due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact; (4) The thiene group (C(C)C) includes functionalities related to piperidine, which can significantly increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, adding about +30. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
